alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Morris County through 700 PM EDT... At 617 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Green Pond to near Budd Lake. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Hopatcong, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mountain Lakes, Stanhope, Riverdale, Netcong, Victory Gardens, Green Pond, Succasunna and Succasunna-Kenvil. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey.
